title: [Torres Strait Islanders, 1898]
other_title: [Haddon, A.C. : Torres Strait Islanders, 1898 : actuality footage]
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Torres Strait Islanders
abstract: A.C. Haddon's pioneering ethnographic footage of Torres Strait Islander people, recorded during the Cambridge University anthropological expedition of 1898.
description: Alfred Cort Haddon was an English anthropologist who led a Cambridge University expedition to the Torres Strait Islands in 1898. His pioneering use of a 35mm camera on this expedition - the first known use of film as an ethnographic record - helped to establish the moving image as a primary tool for anthropological study.  This historic footage is almost certainly the first film ever made that shows indigenous Australian people. The fire-making techniques and dances captured in the footage are fascinating examples of the traditional practices encountered by the expedition.
